text:
In 2014, a nine-year-old
Vietnamese girl

was rushed to a
California emergency room
in excruciating pain.

Her parents didn't
speak English.

And there was no
interpreter available.

She was misdiagnosed and given a
drug her body couldn't tolerate.
Hours later, she died.
This isn't just one story.

30 million patients in the
US face language barriers,

making them 66% more likely
to suffer medical errors,

stay hospitalized longer, and
pay thousands of dollars more
per visit.

Hospitals spend billions
on interpretation services.

Yet, both on-site and
remote interpreters

are often delayed and
inconsistent in quality,

wasting precious time,
putting lives at risk,

and leaving patients
voiceless in their care.

We believe that communication
is at the core of health care.

And that's why
we're building Lexi,

an AI-driven medical
interpretation platform that

makes multilingual communication
instant, accurate, and secure,
at a fraction of the cost.

Our first product is
a mobile application

that enables real-time
voice interpretation

to empower patients to
speak up, and doctors
to provide safer care.

Lexi is built for health care,
fine-tuned on medical lexicon,

and HIPAA-compliant
for patient privacy.

We have received
letters of intent
from major hospital systems.
I am Siddharth from India.
And this is Linh from Vietnam.

And our team together speaks
14 different languages.

And we have firsthand lived
this problem in our families,
in our communities.

If you believe language should
never be a barrier to care,
join us.

Let's make health care
truly accessible for all.
Thank you.
[APPLAUSE]
